WRITING.TEXT: One second of stupidity cost her leg and tax payers money to rescue her.
Worked on this show. Every day was a laugh with Julia and Chris.

It's a mock charge. If an elephant's ear are out and they charge It's a mock charge. When the ears are back that's when it will get messy. But saying that I wouldn't stand there like that. I don't have the guts.
I know a place that would love grandma. Hint: it has white padded walls and lovely white coat that comes with it.
T-800 making some great sounds now.
Aaah the annual Tumbleweed migration. How i long to one day afford a trip to see this amazing sight and hopefully watch a kill as they cross the river.
Look mum. No hand and no feet
Unfortunately most studio cameras are now automated.
Lol thats kinda the point. I should have said effected not changed really.

Imagine a country where there is 1.3 billion people and some white folks visit. The lighter you are the higher you are in social standing. Now imagine a blonde walking around. I've travelled India a lot and as a 6'1 white guy I tend to stand out a little more and this happened to me a lot especially in areas where white people don't go.
Yip. In fact in one remote village I asked them why and their answer was that to them I was god.

Well I once heard (and this could be totally wrong) that anyone that is lighter that them are in a higher social standing. So a lighter Indian are held in high regard. But I could be totally wrong. Whatever it is though, I love India and their slogan is true. Incredible India
No I don't think so. I've travelled with a lot of black guys during our tour and they were experiencing the same. I think it must be if you are Indian.
Yes and no. Its not as simple as that. The ones getting the most attention is most definitely the blonde girls.
No problem
I'm glad it didn't get to your head. Always made me feel really uncomfortable all the attention.

Respect is a bit subjective. It's also not everyone there that does it. Imagine taking a selfie at the top of the Eifel tower. Not the same but similar. Go to their friends and show them what foto they got and feel the euphoria.
Oh I have no doubt that it means that. All I'm relaying is what was said. Thanks for the link and the info.
I have no doubt. I'm originally from South Africa. So I'm always aware of who is around me. (South Africa you have to be mindful of who's around you and where you are)

They were a bunch of nice people and got some good photos with them. We had really good chats and jokes. I tried to tell them the whole time that I'm no better than them. And that we are all the same. We all bleed red and breath the same air in.
Yeah you are absolutely right. Incredible India where the incredible has so many meanings. Good and bad
I think it helped that we were also part of the IPL television crew. Treated like royalty.
No need for you to apologise mate. The whole world is completely whack.
Not saying it happened to her. I was relaying what happened to me and what was said to me. Go read the other comments and you'll see that even Indian people agree with what I said.
Read my comment again
No...you read my comment again
No no... you
Bro you rock. I got a good chuckle out of this. Thanks for playing along
I do like the fact that a lot of the people on here had a bit of a laugh after the scare. Great that people can see the funny side of it.

WRITING.TITLE: Covid 19 has negatively impacted my taste
WRITING.TEXT: Covid 19 has negatively impacted my taste. I now listen to a lot of Michael Bolton. (Adapted from a Jimmy Carr Joke)
Pretty awesome. Good job
Something in the line of - I recently traveled to India and it has effected my taste. I now listen to a lot of Micheal Bolton.
No worries
I suspect you are right.

WRITING.TITLE: Cycling through Swindley forest on a misty morning. Took the photo with my phone. 1908x4032 [OC]
Took this while cycling in Swindley forest in the UK on a misty morning. 1908x4032 [OC]

WRITING.TEXT: Hahaha. A few deceivers and tricksters on the jumps.
Aah my spelling is atrocious. Well picked up mate.
And I can't fix it now. :(
Love it up there. I cycle from Wokingham through the back and up the hill and then straight into the red route. Its a lot quieter now that summer is gone which is great.
Thank you. I'm actually using it as mine now. You are more than welcome to use it if you want. ;)
Totally agree. I see so much more cycling around rather than driving.
I haven't tried many other places. Swinley is great. It's rather quiet now that it's autumn too. Where's Shipwrights and King Alfreds?
